meanings.definition: Control every part, however small, of (an enterprise or activity)
meanings.sent1: She likes to micromanage every project she works on.
meanings.sent2: The boss tends to micromanage his employees' tasks.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how he tries to micromanage even the tiniest details.
meanings.sent4: Her need to micromanage is like trying to control every raindrop in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's way of micromanaging made the class feel suffocated.

meanings.definition: Manage with excessive control or attention to minor details
meanings.sent1: He tends to micromanage his team's work, which can be frustrating.
meanings.sent2: Some people feel stressed when they are micromanaged at work.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how she tries to micromanage even the color of the office walls.
meanings.sent4: His habit of micromanaging is like trying to count every grain of sand on a beach.
meanings.sent5: The chef's way of micromanaging the recipe made it lose its flavor.
